reviews.comment_teaching: The lectures can get boring but the Professor is knowledgeable.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% weekly assignments.
30% midterm.
60% final.
As other math courses, attendance is not required.

Personally:
9.99% Assignments,  1 SD below mean in midterm, and few points above average in the final = final grade B- .
reviews.comment_workload: Weekly assignments, easy if you read the content. There is a little bit more studying when it comes to the final.

reviews.title: work hard and succeed
reviews.comment_content: If I must compare this maths course to other maths course in HKUST, this is fairly easy. Most concepts could be understood if you paid enough effort. I only did so through youtube videos and khan academy, still got a decent grade so just work hard :)
reviews.comment_teaching: I honestly can't stand listening to the lecturers English, I think she is from the mainland? After the first few lectures, most of us skipped class... So I guess the teaching is poorly done. However, the lecture notes are clear and even though the pronunciation is not clear, I could see that she put much effort into teaching so it really depends on whether you can stand her strong accent. If you really needed help you could always find help from MSC anyways, lectures is just a plus :)
reviews.comment_grading: The midterm was unexpectedly easy, so I got 1 sd above mean. If you get the source, the midterms questions are repetitive so you definitely gain an advantage in doing those questions. for finals, i only got mean but still score a B grade. If you are hardworking enough to go through all the sources you could gather, I am sure you would be fine.
reviews.comment_workload: You need to do webwork every week and do finals and midterms but that's it. To be fair every maths course is like this so there really isn't much to say lol. But in terms of revising, I didn't spend too much time on this, when you compare it with maths 1013 or 1014, but this grade is even better... Just chill this maths course is quite decent.

reviews.author: dicky4422
reviews.comment_content: This course includes matrix and vector. About one-third of the lectures cover the DSE curriculum. The remaining content is a bit tough to learn.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor will explain her lecture notes a bit and not just read aloud it. However, you can also learn by yourself as the notes is quite clear and detail.
reviews.comment_grading: The mid-term is extremely easy but final is quite touch. I spend similar effort on both exam and I got 90% at mid-term but 50% at final. Finally I got a B-.
reviews.comment_workload: There are totally 10 webwork through the semester. However the questions are quite tough so you must have to study the lecture notes for a while before you do the webwork.

reviews.author: kms
reviews.title: Review
reviews.comment_content: The course content is not as difficult as other math courses. Even if you do not have background on matrix, it is not difficult to catch up in class. It is strongly recommended to utilize the textbook referenced during the lecture and not rely purely on lecture slides.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lectures alone will be insufficient for a good grasp on the content. Tutorials were very efficient and effective in clarifying doubts during lectures. While the lecturer did manage to cover all the content and provide sufficient examples, there was not enough time to clear all the doubts in the course. The tutor was able to help out a lot during the tutorials.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm was significantly easier as compared to finals.
Recommended to spend more time in preparation for finals.

Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
workload for midterm was manageable.
However, due to scheduling of midterm for math2111, two weeks prior to midterm, when the lecturer is done with midterm syllabus, she will continue on to cover contents for finals even if it is not covered for midterm. This could possibly result in spending more time after midterm to catch up on the missed contents for finals. Time management is strongly recommended.

reviews.author: samuelhe
reviews.title: Fundamental course, good
reviews.comment_content:
Similar to math2011, it’s an essential course for any engineering discipline.

For civil engineering, this course is involved in statics, and 2170, and possibly 3610.

For computer science, linear algebra is important for almost any subdiscipline, especially AI, vision graphics, and theoretical computer science.

Therefore it’s strongly recommended to put enough effort to study this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Wong Ka Yue’s teaching is good and I liked it a lot.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is good, but possibly a bit harsher than math2011. The final was also harder than the 2011 counterpart.
reviews.comment_workload: Just webwork and two exams, although there are some tricky questions in webwork.

reviews.author: Power Ck
reviews.title: Interesting course
reviews.comment_content:
The first 1/3 of the course are about the matrix that contained in DSE M2. After that, are some new concepts.

I feel interested in matrix algebra, so I think the content is acceptable.

Course content:
1. Linear Systems, Elementary Row Operations, Row Echelon Forms
2. Vector Spaces, Linear Combinations, Matrix Multiplication
3. Equivalent Forms and Solution Structure of Linear System, Linear Independence
4. Linear Transformations and Matrices
5. One-to-one, Onto Linear Transformations and Invertible Matrices, Determinants
6. Determinants, Elementary Matrices, Cramer’s Rule, Area, Vector Spaces
7. Null Spaces, Column Spaces, Linear Transformations, Linear Independent Sets and Bases
8. More Examples on Null Spaces, Column Spaces, Linear Transformations, Linear Independent Sets and Bases
9. Bases of Null Space and Column Space, Coordinate Systems
10. Dimensions of Vector Spaces, Matrices of Linear Transformations, Eigenvalues, Eigenvectors and Characteristic Equations
11. Similar Matrices, Diagonalization, Diagonalizable Matrices, Application to Differential Equations
12. Application to Differential Equations, Inner Product, Length, Orthogonality, Orthogonal Sets
13. Orthogonal Projection, Orthonormal Sets
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Ho

The teaching method of HHM are pretty nice and famous, I do not think I need to say too much about this.
reviews.comment_grading: Same as many courses in UST, above mean a bit (within an SD), I got a B-.
reviews.comment_workload: Only WebWork, easy.

reviews.author: MS01
reviews.title: Good Professor, Good Content
reviews.comment_content:
Referring to chapters in the textbook

Chapter 1: Linear Equations in Linear Algebra
Chapter 2: Matrix Algebra
Chapter 3: Determinants
Chapter 4: Vector Space
Chapter 5: Eigenvales & Eigenvectors
Chapter 6: Orthogonality & Least Squares

Since the teaching time is limited in the summer semester, some topics in orthogonality are excluded, such as The Orthonormal Decomposition Theorem, The Best Approximation Theorem and The Gram-Schmidt Process.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Most of the teaching time of Dr. HO is following a step by step procedure to show you how to set up and solve the problem. Have some illustration to let you better understand different theorem. Some questions appear in the lecture notes can be found in the examinations.

However, the teaching of the TA was not good because he often made careless mistakes when doing the examples. Just take the tutorial notes and practice the exercises by yourself is OK.

Lecture Videos are also available in Canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading:
10% WeBWork

30% Mid-term Exam
(mean: 70.69, SD: 18.3)

60% Final Exam
(mean: 54.54, SD: 20.04)

WeBWork Full Mark + Mid-term Exam Around Mean + Final Exam 1 SD Above Mean → B+
reviews.comment_workload:
6 WeBWorks in one month.

Compare with MATH 1014, some questions have limited trials and you should answer those questions carefully without random guess.

reviews.author: lucy Yin
reviews.comment_content: Matrix caculation. If you want to go future study, you'd better take MATH2121.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite good. I really like him. You don't need to print the notes and he would do so.
reviews.comment_grading: I think grading is quite good. I got A. Just finished the homework and went to the class. At the beginning of each class, he would do a summary of previous class which is quite useful for preparing the exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Just like other Math class, the workload was not quite high. There were around 10 homework each of which counted 1%.

reviews.author: CKL
reviews.comment_content:
1. Linear equations in linear algebra
2. Matrix Algebra
3. Determinants
4. Vector spaces
5. Eigenvalues and eigenspaces
6. Orthogonality

The content before midterm comprises of the first 3 topics, which is quite easy to handle for students who have taken M2 in HKDSE. However, the content goes more difficult after the midterm, because some concepts about vector space are quite abstract, and those questions often require rigorous proves.
Since the lecture time is not enough, some topics in orthogonality are not included, such as orthogonal projection, properties about orthogonal matrix, best approximation theorem and the Gram-Schmidt Process.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching of Dr. Ho is awesome. He explain the concepts clearly and I can feel his passion for teaching. He will upload videos of every lecture on canvas and distribute colorful lecture notes on class. The only drawback is that he is not willing to upload his notes on canvas, so you have to attend every lesson in order to get his notes.

However, I think the TA is not quite good. He does not prepare the tutorials well, as he sometimes made careless mistakes in calculations, which wastes a lot of time. Also, he uploaded the answers of tutorial notes lately, sometimes ever a week late, which hinders my progress of revision.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading:
10% Hw
30% Midterm
60% final exam

Statistics:
Midterm:
mean = 70.69 (out of 100)
s.d = 18.3
Final exam:
mean = 54.54 (out of 100)
s.d = 20.04

Personally, I think the difficulty of both midterm and final exam are appropriate, if you can handle all the examples in the lecture notes and tutorial notes, you should get at least one s.d above mean. However, the mean score especially the final exam is lower than my expectation.
reviews.comment_workload:
I think the workload of this course is quite low. Dr. Ho only finish about 10 pages of lecture note in each 3-hour lecture. Since this course was held in summer semester, about 20 pages per week is acceptable.

There is one webwork per week as a homework, but most of the questions are easy. The only caution is that some questions have limited trials, so you should answer carefully without random guess.

reviews.author: trashsosad
reviews.title: prof好俾心機教
reviews.comment_content: matrix，如果中學有讀m2咁頭1-2個星期就係幫你溫書，中間有d topic都會學過，例如搵determinant、inverse；難明嘅topic我覺得就只有一個，係講緊睇埋書問埋人都唔係好明個種，其餘都只要有上足堂、有睇example都會明
reviews.comment_teaching:
prof好有心教，因為我第一個星期係上另一個prof嘅，悶到飛起所以轉左時間，轉完先發現係第二個世界。依個prof主要用白板教，會用曬唔同顏色嘅marker黎寫，假如你miss左少少野，一睇d顏色都好易catch up返；講又清楚，又多example；所以對matrix冇咩信心就上多d堂咁都應該輕鬆嘅

但係tutorial就…（你上完lecture唔會想上tutorial）
reviews.comment_grading:
同year1嘅math course大致相同，都係15%homework，35%midterm，50%final

我homework ~95%，midterm 50%，final 55%，咁就B左（早知再努力d）
reviews.comment_workload:
平時基本都只係得homework，冇quiz，佢會有d recommend嘅題目俾你，d題目係書到，咁都係做下個d

我就臨考前就有做曬recommend題目

reviews.author: kittycatapult
reviews.comment_content: Content wasn't very interesting in my opinion, easily the hardest course I've taken so far
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wong is a good teacher with a relatively easier to understand accent compared to Jishan Hu
Furthermore, he goes over the previous class's material in every class making the transition from one topic to another smoother
reviews.comment_grading:
The class mean is usually around 45-50, which is pretty low. The SD however, hovers around 15-20
It is recommended to solve the book in order to get a good grade in the course
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is low, only around 2-3 assignments a month

reviews.author: Ricky Yu
reviews.comment_content:
全部野都係融匯貫通
只要concept清晰 做多D數 應付midterm一定冇難度
黎黎去去都係個D野

Daniel 既notes真係好清楚
有圖表講埋唔同topic之間既關係
溫書既時侯自己run through一次D Corollary
確保自己可以prove到 Corollary係最重要
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wong Ka Yue Daniel 教得好好
Hu, Jishan 就教得好HEA
上左Hu 幾堂決定sit Daniel
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term and Final above 1 SD
Webwork Full Mark
Get A-
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork only

reviews.author: Sean Cha
reviews.title: Short Review
reviews.comment_content: The content is pretty straight forward and not very difficult if you're even slightly familiar with linear algebra.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is very boring so I don't recommend going to every class.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is quite intense as other Math courses and you should look forward to at least 1.2 SD above in order to expect A-range. However, since a lot of students take class, the mean is not that very high. So, if you prepare enough, you can expect for B+ to A-.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not intense at all. You only need to finish some hw online which can be solved right away.

reviews.author: WilliamLo
reviews.comment_content: Systems of linear equations; vector spaces; linear transformations; matrix representation of linear transformations; linear operators, eigenvalues and eigenvectors; similarity invariants and canonical forms.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very good. The lecturer always reviewed the content before the lecture started and he can deliver the abstract concept into easier way which can make people much easier to understand what he taught. Moreover, he encouraged people ask question for better understanding.
reviews.comment_grading: Absolute grading. If your mid-term and final reach mean, you get B-.
reviews.comment_workload: Not too much, webwork only. In total six sets of homework with twenty problems. Many problems have unlimited attendance except multiple choice problems which related to the concept

reviews.author: nangyo
reviews.comment_content: Systems of linear equations; vector spaces; linear transformations; matrix representation of linear transformations; linear operators, eigenvalues and eigenvectors; similarity invariants and canonical forms.
reviews.comment_teaching: I do not really know much about the instructor since i did not attend any lectures except the first one. At a glance, he did not seem to be effective.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading scheme is the same as any other math courses. Webwork is pretty easy and helpful. However, other students taking this course seemed not to be adroit in mathematics. Mean was very low although there is not pre-knowledge required for this course.

midterm: about mean
final: 1.5sd above
A-
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is very light. There are very few chapters and not much to learn. Also, materials are not that hard to understand. Key point is to deeply understand concepts that seem very confusing at first.

reviews.author: maryloooo
reviews.comment_content:
Linear equation systems
Matrix algebra
Determinants
Vector spaces and subspaces - bases, coordinates and dimensions
Eigenvectors, diagonalization
Inner product spaces, orthogonality

Interesting lessons with some basic theorems and they can be applied in real life.
If you studied m2 in DSE, this course can help you to understand more about matrix and determinant that you learnt before.

WeBWorK: 10%
Midterm Exam: 30%
Final Exam: 60%
reviews.comment_teaching:
As it is summer term, each lecture last for 3 hours. For me, It is quite hard to stay focus for 3 hours.

The lecture note of Dr HO is full of words and in color. He explains each example in a systematical way and you can read the example by yourself to know more about the knowledge.

However you need to attain all the lessons in order to get his note. His taught the knowledge by writing out the things on paper and project them into screen. Personally, it is very clear but hard to catch up as the teaching time is limited in summer term.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term Around mean + Final 1.5 SD Above mean -> B+

If you can study all examples in lecture notes, it will help you to get a C/C-.

If you want to get a better grade, you need to do the exercises in book and understand the theories behind the exercise.
reviews.comment_workload:
6 Webworks in one month.
When the things become harder, you have to spend more time in order to get 100% in work.

reviews.author: Pang.
reviews.comment_content:
Linear equation systems
Matrix algebra
Determinants
Vector spaces and subspaces - bases, coordinates and dimensions
Eigenvectors, diagonalization
Inner product spaces, orthogonality, Gram-Schmidt process, least squares problems

Quite useful. At least better than calculus (from a CS student's perspective)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lee's lectures could get boring but that's not something uncommon. What's not good is that when you decides to self-study and read his notes, you find that there is 60-120 slides of text in each chapter that is not easy to understand.

In comparison, Wong Ka Yue's version is comparatively clearer and more intelligible. But then we dont really get to choose for this semester... oh well.
reviews.comment_grading:
Again this is part of the syllabus where mainland students has already studied prior to entering uni. If you can perform well in both MT and final then there is no need to worry much; otherwise the situation may get a little bit nasty.

Doing past papers should be helpful, as with other MATH courses.

Above mean slightly less than 1.5SD for MT and final -> A
reviews.comment_workload:
This is one of the courses with the least amount of assignments, among all courses with Webwork - 6 for this semester, once every two weeks. In contrast, there may be >20 questions in some of the assignments.
Getting 100% should not be difficult - though I failed to do so due to some unsuccessful deadline fighting :)

reviews.author: AAAAAA
reviews.comment_content: I think the content is very good. This is math, what you expect to learn should be how to solve the problems. And this is not an elective, you take it because you have to, so you can really learn something.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is very enthusiastic, speaks very loudly and makes jokes about himself. He gives examples and explains things clearly. You can always follow his pace.
reviews.comment_grading: Mean is low, sd is ok, acceptable. I think most people didn't really study this course. If you understand every concept in the lecture notes, do the webwork carefully, and do some extra exercises, you will get above 1.5 sd at least.
reviews.comment_workload: They only assess exams and webwork. But I always think math is not you know the concept and you can work out the problems. You always need practice to make yourself familiar with it. So if you just finish the things they assigned you, you won't get good grade, and the workload will be light. However, in order to get good grade, you have to get a little bit more workload, which is still not so heavy.

reviews.author: Steeve
reviews.title: Good Professor, Good Grade
reviews.comment_content: The material covers most of the information you have to know about linear algebra. Generally speaking, the content is quite simple compared to math 1014.
reviews.comment_teaching: Wong is the Best math instructor I have ever met in HKUST. Not only did he teach logically, but he was also willing to answer any questions students may have after class. His passionate in teaching this course really inspired me that I dare not skip any one of the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fairly generous. I got around a grade lies around 1.2 SD above mean and eventually received an A.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is reasonable, similar to math 1014. You don't need to spend lots of time on absorbing the materials, which is partly because of the nice teaching by the instructor.

reviews.author: Ivan01234
reviews.comment_content: midterm前教下matrix, 有讀M2會學過所以問題唔大, 之後會教vector space, eigenvalue and diagonalizable matrix, inner product space and application(e.g linear regression line), concept比midterm 前d野抽象, 走堂自己追番會相對吃力
reviews.comment_teaching: 英文1999, 可以睇得出上堂無準備同教得差, 最好去sit其他lecture d堂(特別係MIDTERM之後)
reviews.comment_grading:
webwork:10%
midterm:30%
final:60%
本人MIDTERM above mean 0.7sd, final above 1 sd 結果b+
reviews.comment_workload: 有webwork 同 tutorial notes, 明哂入面D野就唔難

reviews.author: Mew
reviews.comment_content:
The first half of the course which appeared on the midterm was relatively basic stuff about matrices such as using augmented matrices to represent linear systems of equations, basic matrix operations, determinants and linear independence.

The second half involved vector spaces, eigenvectors/eigenvalues, orthogonal bases and the least squares problem.

Although discussed near the end of the course, chapter 7, "Symmetric Matrices and Quadratic Forms", did not appear on the final.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching in the lectures was acceptable but I didn't really attend that many classes because I found it more efficient to read from the textbook.

I found the tutorials hard to follow and often got confused when the TA was explaining a problem.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Webwork
30% Midterm
60% Final

Midterm mean 61.7, SD 13.6
Final mean 56.5, SD 18.6

Both the midterm and final had multiple choice questions worth 20% and written answer type questions worth the rest.

I felt that there wasn't enough time on either the midterm or the final because the questions involved a lot of computation (Example: find the product of a 4*2 matrix and a 2*4 matrix to get a 4*4 matrix which ended up with 36 as the denominator for each element). Because of the amount of numbers you have to deal with, it is easy to make a mistake and frustratingly lose points and you might not have enough time to check your computations because of the time limit.
reviews.comment_workload:
There were 6 Webwork homework sets spread throughout the semester. Each took me about 2 hours to finish. Sometimes the numbers got rather ugly and it was impossible to compute the answer by hand. If you know how to use MATLAB or Octave (programming languages with built-in matrix functions), you might be able to save some time.

This is not necessary but since you can bring any HKEAA approved calculator with you (including programmable ones), it is possible to store programs to find matrix products or determinants which might help during the exam. One program took about 40 minutes to input.

reviews.author: gossipgirl
reviews.comment_content:
The content is really interesting and has a variety of interlinked concepts. 7 main sections:
1. Intro to Matrices
2. Linear Dependence
3. Determinants
4. Vector Spaces
5. Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors
6. Orthogonality
7. Symmetric Matrices
reviews.comment_teaching: This section may vary from person to person depending on how he/she interprets Lee's lectures. They are definitely helpful and worth attending. Some say it becomes boring but well, again really depends.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is good if you score well. Narrow margins so gaining or losing a couple of marks here and there can change your grade,
WebWork - 10%
Midterm - 30%
Final - 60%

~87 A, ~90 A+

Final can have a major impact on your grade
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is pretty much standard like all math courses. The book is really really good and good practice will give you an advantage for the exams.

reviews.author: sgargaa
reviews.title: The course is great
reviews.comment_content: The content is decent, because this course has many applications, and this course hence, forms as a pre-requisite or a co-requisite for many other courses.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor was very monotonous and did not explain anything very well. I would suggest that you go with Professor Lee. In fact, for my own preparation, I used his notes and lecture slides as they were way more detailed.
reviews.comment_grading:
10%  Online Webwork Exercises
30%  Midterm Test
60%  Final Examination
The grading his pretty harsh and so is the curve. The mean is typically C+, and the papers are tough.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not that great. Very recently, the course has been upgraded from a 2-credit course to a 3-credit course.
PS- Try going for tutorials, as most questions in the midterm and final are from the tutorial worksheets.

reviews.author: whyMarco
reviews.comment_content:
Matrix multiplication, vector matices

He speaks quickly and stutters, and will scare people when he thinks the classroom is getting noisy. On the good side, he will gladly answer any questions and organize regular consultation sessions.

grade: A

reviews.author: I_am_a_turtle
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course is not too hard compared to MATH 2111, if you have a sufficient math background, I bet you can handle this course quite easily.
reviews.comment_teaching: Chan teaches not quite well actually, he is not a lecturer which does not know how to teach, though it is his last teaching. Also, his teaching mode is quite strange. I think other lecturers may have better teaching :]
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is yet to be released so I do not have much information.
reviews.comment_workload: Actually, there are not many assignments given, we just need to do 1 webwork per week. Also, we just need to do past papers before the final exam. Therefore, there is not much workload.

reviews.author: JangJackzel
reviews.title: Good Grading I Think
reviews.comment_content:
Check other reviews for the contents.

This course in spring misses quite a lot of the content compared to the same course in fall. Probably becuz there are more holidays in the spring semester maybe so if you want to learn properly, take the course in the fall semester.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is very nice especially for beginners. He goes through the calculation steps very thoroughly and he answers most of the questions raised during the lecture. I think he is a nice person too. I would definitely take his other courses if I have a choice
reviews.comment_grading:
You can refer to other reviews for the exact stats.

For me, I made a stupid mistake in the midterm and got one question wrong. But you should definitely get full mark for the midterm cuz it's much easier than the finals. (Prof said 80% of the ppl got full marks in the midterm)

In the finals, I got two questions wrong giving me 27/33.

Finally, I got an A. Quite surprised with my grade actually. I was expecting an A- or a B+ after seeing the means but I think the curve was quite good.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload. Most of my workload came from writing notes of the lecture content. (I'm a bit disappointed about not being able to learn what others learned in the fall term and imo the missing contents are the relatively practical ones that can be applied in real life)

Presentation is also very easy. He just gives u a math problem and asks you to explain the steps to reach the solution. The question is very easy and you won't need much (or even any) preparation to start filming.

Webwork is also easy and most of them provide unlimited attempts.

If you want good grades, take this course in spring. If you want to learn, take it in fall.

reviews.author: LALA8310
reviews.title: Hea Prof
reviews.comment_content:
Chap 1             Systems of Linear Equations  (~10 hours)
(i) Systems of Linear Equations; (ii) Row Reduction and Echelon Forms; (iii) Vector Equations;
(iv) The Matrix Equation ; (v) Solution Sets of Linear Systems; (vi) Linear Independence;
(vii) Linear Transformations; (viii) The Matrix of a Linear Transformation.

Chaps 2 and 3  Matrix Algebra and Determinants  (~8 hours)
(i) Matrix Operations; (ii) Matrix Inverse; (iii) Characterizations of Invertible Matrices;
(iv) Introduction to Determinants; (v) Properties of Determinants;
(vi) Cramer's Rule, Volume, and Linear Transformations


Chap 4             Vector Spaces  (~6 hours)
(i) Vector Spaces and Subspaces; (ii) Null Spaces, Column Spaces, and Linear Transformations;
(iii) Linearly Independent Sets and Bases; (iv) Coordinate Systems;
(v) The dimension of a Vector Space and Rank of a Matrix.

Chap 5             Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors  (~4 hours)
(i) Eigenvectors and Eigenvalues; (ii) The Characteristic Equation; (iii) Diagonalization;
(iv) Applications to Dynamical Systems and Differential Equations.

Chap 6             Inner Product Spaces  (~6 hours)
(i) Inner Product, Length, and Orthogonality; (ii) Orthogonal Sets; (iii) Orthogonal Projections;
(iv) The Gram-Schmidt Process; (v) Least-Squares Problems; (vi) Applications to Linear Models.

Chap 7             Symmetric Matrices and Quadratic Forms  (~2 hours)
(i) Diagonalization of Symmetric Matrices; (ii) Quadratic Forms and the Principal Axes Theorem.

reviews.author: {Curly Braces}
reviews.title: Math course with some difficulty
reviews.comment_content:
The contents are mainly focused on linear algebra. It consists of 7 chapters:
1. Systems of Linear Equations
2. Matrix Algebra
3. Determinants
4. Vector Spaces
5. Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors
6. Inner Product Spaces
7. Symmetric Matrices and Quadratic Forms

In details, there are contents with some difficulty to understand:
a. Vector Subspaces (Chapter 4)
b. Basis (Chapter 4)
c. Row Spaces, Column Spaces and Null Spaces (Chapter 4)
d. Matrix Diagonalization (Chapter 5)
e. Dynamical System and Differential Equation (Chapter 5)
f. Normalization to Orthonormal Basis with G.S. Method (Chapter 6)

Note that although the course has taught dynamical systems and differential equations, it almost never appeared in the final exams (including the past papers).

This makes sense since they require much more computation than the rest of the topics, and most questions even involve decimal places (even the exercises on Classviva is so!), which would be difficult to compute, considering that the exams do not allow calculators.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Ye gave a lot of effort into this course. She wrote the lecture notes by hand and proved most of the concepts. The accent is acceptable but still not very good.
However, since the exams are more focused on the concepts in this semester, heavily relying on her notes is not enough.

Prof. Yin is also on the instructor list since he substituted Prof. Ye for weeks due to Ye got a sick leave for several weeks. I think there is not much to say about him, considering the madness of lambol and jello.

Because of this, it is more important for you to self-study.

(I cannot give any comments about the tutorials, since I skipped almost all of them lmao)
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme:
Homework: 10%
Midterm: 30%
Final 60%

Same as MATH1012/1013/1014, in order to have a better grade, getting 100% in homework is a must.

For the exams, since this is an online semester, the exams are all MCQs on Canvas. This results in the questions are more focused on concepts over calculation. This is probably why the mean would be lower than the previous semesters.
Midterm: 75/100 (mean: 55.1)
Final part 1: 13/20 (mean: 11.3)
Final part 2: 17/20 (mean: 13.1)

Final grade: A- (77.5%)

The grading is pretty much fine. The cutoff for A- in this semester is about 76%.
reviews.comment_workload:
For students who have studied DSE M2 before, should found pre-midterm contents (Chapter 1-3) easy. However, post-midterm contents are still difficult. More time would be needed to study these topics.

Remember, there are exercises on Classviva that can help you to clear the concepts!

Other than Classviva, there are also some good sources for self-study this course including 3blue1brown's Youtube Channel and Jeffrey Chasnov's (The professor who teach MATH2350) Youtube Channel.

Apart from that, there is only 10 homework to work on. Most of them have fair difficulty, except HW10, which is pretty much inhuman.

reviews.author: DrainGang
reviews.title: Decent math course compared to 1013/14
reviews.comment_content:
Systems of linear equations
vector spaces
linear transformations
matrix representation of linear transformations
linear operators, eigenvalues and eigenvectors
similarity invariants and canonical forms

Basic linear algebra, not very difficult even if you are a M1 student like me, I would even say that it is a little bit interesting once you know what you are doing in the course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor YE was not bad, despite the somewhat heavy accent, she was able to teach clearly and convey the ideas well, however the lectures do get boring since she is mostly reading off the notes, which were quite well-written as they were clear and included example questions so you know how to do them in the exams.

However the notes are not very effective in teaching the concepts of the course, which is important since the exams have a strong focus on the concepts, to do well in this course a solid grasp of the concepts is a must, therefore, go on youtube and search "3blue1brown" and watch their series on linear algebra, I can guarantee it would be worth it and be more effective then reading notes in terms of learning concepts.

Tutorials are whatever, skipped most of them as attendance were not compulsory, and from the few that I attended, the content was basic and did not help much.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework: 10%
Midterm: 30%
Finals: 60%

Homework: WebWork, one assignment per week, infinite tries/multiple tries for MCQS. Very easy and most students would get full marks on them easily.

Midterm: 20 questions, covers everything from the beginning to vector spaces, strong emphasis on concepts, not too difficult. Mean: 11/20

Finals: covers the entire course, less strong but still heavy emphasis on concepts, SIMILAR FOCUS ON ALL CONCEPTS, this means there will be questions based on the pre-midterm materials, not too difficult once again. Mean: 25/40

My grades:
9.8/10 on homework due to a mistake on 1 question...
19.5/30% on midterm (+0.5sd)
36/60% on finals (1.5% lower than mean)

This semester was online so keep in mind that cheating is rampant.

Overall had around 3% higher than mean, and got a B, expected a B- so good grading compared to year 1 math courses.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light for a math course.

WebWork does not take too much time, and the finals don't take too long to study for since there isn't a strong emphasis on the calculations. Just study the concepts and you should do OK.

A very useful and valuable advise from the previous reviews is GO OVER THE 3BLUE1BROWN LINEAR ALGEBRA SERIES on youtube.

Would update if it comes out.

reviews.comment_workload:
It takes time to understand and digest the knowledge if you are new to linear algebra, or you only know how to calculate them. However, do NOT give up. You can do really very well if you have done so, and you can also have a MUCH MORE SOLID UNDERSTANDING of linear algebra than most of the engineering students on this planet.
Do yourself a favor to go over the concept questions in the pastpapers, it also helps a ton.

reviews.comment_content:
This is a fully fledged course on linear algebra for year-one students. We shall cover topics on systems of linear equations, matrices, determinants, vectors in n-dimensional spaces, linear transformations, change of basis, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, diagonalization, inner products, orthogonal projection, Gram-Schmidt process, diagonalization of symmetric matrices and quadratic forms.

reviews.comment_workload:
Workload for this course is not worth 3 cred. Although there is only one assignment per week, most of the time I've spent is on catching up with the course material since it is sometimes confusing to understand; if you can't keep up you will lose track really quickly. I screwed up my Midterm because of this: keep practicing your Maths and keep up with the pace.

If you have not learnt matrix / vector during high school then pay full attention in the tutorial lessons: those lesson will keep you up to pace with the others while you are falling behind.

reviews.author: Dedrick

However, to aim for an A range grade, you need to spend time regularly practicing and grasping the concepts since they are highly inter-related.

reviews.title: OK啦 !
reviews.comment_content:
This one-month course had been conducted from 17/6 to 19/7. There were 3 nos. 3-hrs lectures and 1 nos. 2-hrs tutorial in each week.

The coverage of this course in this semester was similar to that the course was in the regular semesters. If you want to take this course in the upcoming summer semester, it is recommended that you should prepare this course early.

Textbook: Linear Algebra And Its Applications 5th Edition

The teaching schedule was as below:
(The numbers below refer to the chapter/sub-chapter of the textbook.)

1st week (17/6, 19/6, 21/6)
1.1 - System of Linear Equations
1.2 - Row Reduction and Echelon Forms
1.3 - Vector Equations
1.4 - The Matrix Equation Ax=b
1.5 - Solution Sets of Linear Systems
1.7 - Linear Independence
1.8 - Introduction to Linear Transformation
1.9 - The Matrix of a Linear Transformation

2nd week (24/6, 26/6, 28/6)
2.1 - Matrix Operation
2.2 - The Inverse of a Matrix
2.3 - Characterization of Invertible Matrices
3.1 - Introduction to Determinants
3.2 - Properties of Determinants
3.3 - Cramer's Rule, Volume, and Linear Transformation
4.1 - Vector Spaces and Subspaces
4.2 - Null Spaces, Column Spaces and Linear Transformations

3rd week (3/7, 5/7)
4.2 - Null Spaces, Column Spaces and Linear Transformations
4.3 - Linear Independent Sets, Bases
4.4 - Coordinate Systems
4.5 - The Dimension of a Vector Space
4.6 - Rank

4th week (8/7, 10/7, 12/7)
5.1 - Eigenvectors and Eigenvalues
5.2 - The Characteristic Equations
5.3 - Diagonalization
5.6 - Discrete Dynamical Systems
5.7 - Applications to Differential Equations
6.1 - Inner Product, Length and Orthogonality
6.2 - Orthogonal Sets
6.3 - Orthogonal Projection
6.4 - The Gram-Schmidt Process
6.5 - Least-Square Problems
6.6 - Applications to Linear Models

5th week (15/7)
6.6 - Applications to Linear Models
7.1 - Diagonalization of Symmetric Matrices

19/7 --> 3 hrs final exam covering all content above
(NOT allowed to use calculator in exam)
reviews.comment_teaching:
The Instructor provided hand-written notes which is easy to understand but not enough information. Reading textbook may help you understand the concept deeply.

Her teaching style was acceptable. I had attended all her lessons because following the progress was quite important within a short time.

She also introduced the question bank, Classviva (https://www.classviva.org/login/index.php), in which the textbook exercises with solutions are listed out. This platform is good for you to know different type of questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
6 webworks (40%)
1 Final Exam (60%)

Mean of the final exam: 65.85

Although webwork occupied a quite high percentage, the final grade would depend on the score distribution in the final exam. I guess that this setting may be helpful for students to pass this course.

The final exam included 15 nos. mc quesions in total 30 marks and 5 (or 6) nos. computation questions in total 70 marks respectively. The exam was easy.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload was acceptable.

Doing webwork did not spend me long time.

Completing a math course within one month is a nice experience !

reviews.author: Nishu
reviews.comment_content: The content was relatively dry but that is to be expected from an introductory level math course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor was accommodating to students when they missed lecture and helped to make the curriculum accessible. Lecture Notes are provided for making annotations
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was fairly low, there were only 6 webworks plus one final exam that make up the entire grade. I would say that studying the material on your own time is an important aspect to add to the workload as the final exam comprises 60% of the final grade

reviews.author: CourseReviewer
reviews.title: Stupid, Unreasonable Grading
reviews.comment_content:
Content was good. Covered many topics such as reduced row echelon form, homogeneous and non-homogeneous linear systems, linear independence, linear transformations, eigenvectors, etc.

Relatively easier than other math courses. Theories, however, may require extensive memorization, and you need to be able to link several theories together (e.g. theorem A may imply theorem B, which in turn indicates that theorem C applies to both A and B)
reviews.comment_teaching: No comment about teaching, but lecture notes were good and informative.
reviews.comment_grading:
Stupid and unreasonable grading.

10% Webwork
30% Midterm
60% Finals

10% Webwork- Full
30% Midterm- I scored 56/80, mean was 44, SD 15 (mean+0.8SD)
60% Finals- I scored 76/100, mean was 48, SD 19
(mean+1.5 SD)

With the above statistics, assuming a normal distribution, I scored in the top 10% of the class.

Ended up with a B+, with no explanation whatsoever from Dr Ho. Even mentioned that I was far from the A-range cutoff. All in all, unreasonable. Wouldn't recommend taking this course with Dr. Ho- your efforts are and will not be recognized.
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork.

reviews.author: Justin Li
reviews.title: Basic level Math course but still requires some serious working
reviews.comment_content: Quite a lot of topics on Matrix and linear algebra that have to be covered. Topics before mid-term including elementary row operations, linear transformations, matrix inverse and determinants are basic concepts and some are likely taught in high school. Topics after mid-term including vector space, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, orthogonality are much more advance and requires paying much more attention and time on them.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lectures: Lecturer is easy to follow and understand in general. Due to tight schedule, lecturer may speed up from time to time, so you have to pay extra attention. Lecturer may write examples on the whiteboard which are important but cannot be found on lecture slides.
Tutorials: TA is very helpful if you are confused and need explanation (Common in this course since some topics is rather abstract).
reviews.comment_grading: 30% from mid-term, 60% from final exam, 10% from WebWork. Not difficult to get 100% in WebWork as long as your work according to schedule. Mid-term is easier and so a good chance to pull up your grades (Mean is around 75%).  Final is much more difficult and requires more study to get good grades (Mean around 65%).
reviews.comment_workload: Requires some serious working and you should allocate some time for this course. WebWork doesn't take much time to complete. If you attend most lectures (especially after mid-term) your won't need too much revision. If you miss many lectures expect a lot of revising. More practices can guarantee a good grade.

reviews.author: 橘
reviews.comment_content:
week 1: Systems of linear equations, Row reduction and echelon forms, Homogeneous linear systems and solution structure, Matrix Transformations, Matrix operations, Matrix Inverses

week 3: Elementary Matrices, Determinants and its properties, Cramer’s Rule and inverse formula, Areas and Volumes, Vector Spaces and Subspaces, Subspaces associated with matrices, Linear Independent Sets and Bases, Coordinate Systems and dimension

week 5: Rank theorem, Eigenvectors, Eigenvalues and their applications, Homogeneous Systems of First Order Linear ODEs

week 7: Inner Product Spaces, Orthogonality and orthonormal sets, Orthogonal projections  


Gram-Schmidt process, Least square solutions and Applications 沒有足夠時間講述，但如果每課都有上的話，要自習應該不難
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ho Hon Ming : 講解很詳細，每一步的邏輯也解釋得很仔細務求學生能明白每個計算步驟的意義

Zeta Chan : 很盡責的一位助教，不斷給我們不同的material，也盡所能去講解以確保我們明白當中的概念。尤其是Vector Space的概念，Zeta 抽了一題比較特別的題目來講解Vector Space,加深了對zero vector 的認識
reviews.comment_grading:
評分比預期的好，但midterm的題目和其他sem比會有挑戰性，但也是合理的範圍內，有溫習的話要合格是不難

10% webwork
30% midterm
60% final
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload算少，只有Webwork，而且難度不高，考基本的概念和應用

總共有6份webwork，但計算的過程比較繁複，如果不用軟件幫助應該可以花一整天時間去完成

reviews.author: Darshna
reviews.comment_content:
The content is pretty good. Course content:
1. Linear Systems, Elementary Row Operations, Row Echelon Forms
2. Vector Spaces, Linear Combinations, Matrix Multiplication
3. Equivalent Forms and Solution Structure of Linear System, Linear Independence
4. Linear Transformations and Matrices
5. One-to-one, Onto Linear Transformations and Invertible Matrices, Determinants
6. Determinants, Elementary Matrices, Cramer’s Rule, Area, Vector Spaces
7. Null Spaces, Column Spaces, Linear Transformations, Linear Independent Sets and Bases
8. More Examples on Null Spaces, Column Spaces, Linear Transformations, Linear Independent Sets and Bases
9. Bases of Null Space and Column Space, Coordinate Systems
10. Dimensions of Vector Spaces, Matrices of Linear Transformations, Eigenvalues, Eigenvectors and Characteristic Equations
11. Similar Matrices, Diagonalization, Diagonalizable Matrices, Application to Differential Equations
12. Application to Differential Equations, Inner Product, Length, Orthogonality, Orthogonal Sets
13. Orthogonal Projection, Orthonormal Sets
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is very boring.. Only reads from the slides, and the solves examples slowly on the board. It's pointless attending his lectures half the time. The tutorials were a lot more helpful in understanding the concepts
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is not too bad.
reviews.comment_workload: Only webwork due every saturday. Not much workload.

reviews.author: toxicboi
reviews.comment_content:
Linear Algebra using vectors and matrices. Difficult to understand the vector part but matrices are easy.
10% Webwork Homework
30% Midterm
60% Final
Mostly focus on final otherwise whole grade will go down.
reviews.comment_teaching: Boring, mostly self learning. Used many other resources to try to understand the concepts. The slide materials are old and not explanatory.
reviews.comment_grading: If you score mean you will get in C range. Mean goes low and SD goes high. My mean was around 55/100 but SD was near to 20.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload but have to study hard in finals and midterm.

reviews.author: Wilson Liu
reviews.comment_content: The content cover a lots of vectors and matrix  calculation in terms of coordination operation.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is boring but he taught everything in a very detail way.
reviews.comment_grading:
If you do the homework your own, the exam should be easy for you to achieve a good grade.
Basically you have to have 90+ to get A range, 80+ for B range and below would normally be C range.
reviews.comment_workload: A few online homework assignment and a few quiz. I suggest you to spend more time on the home work because it would be very helpful for the quiz and exams

reviews.author: syllllll
reviews.comment_content:
matrix, linear algebra,linear transformation

it is hard for M1 student because I have never learned anything about matrix, also it is difficult for me to find the span. the final exam was almost all about span, then I got low marks.

actually, the professor is very nice, i missed an assignment, but he extended the deadline for me.but a little bit boring in teaching.

it has a heavy workload if u study in the summer with a physics course, but it is not hard to get a high grade if u study in a regular semester.
reviews.comment_teaching:
boring teaching
sleepy in lecture
reviews.comment_grading:
full mark in Hw
not bad in final
reviews.comment_workload: the reasonable workload in a regular semester.

reviews.author: Adrian Man
reviews.title: exam suck
reviews.comment_content:
Chap 1             Systems of Linear Equations  (~10 hours)

reviews.comment_teaching: haven't attend any lecture so no comment
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade : F
mid term and final all mc, mostly about concept, doing hw or tutorial exercise hv not use cuz most of them are calculation. cannot even know wtf the question is asking.
reviews.comment_workload: one webwork every week, can solve using online calculator or google. spend around 1 hr per hw.

reviews.author: Haochen
reviews.comment_content:
It includes 7 chapters, basic knowledge in linear algebra.
1. Systems of Linear Equations
2. Matrix Algebra
3. Determinants
4. Vector Spaces
5. Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors
6. Inner Product Spaces
7. Symmetric Matrices and Quadratic Forms
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof.Ye prepared very well for every class. Except handwritten notes, she would prove and explain theories very clearly to make students have a deep comprehension and  pause for questions during class. Meanwhile, appropriate examples were provided in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Assignment
30% Midterm
60% Final
All questions in Final and Midterm are MC.
Exams mostly focus on concepts rather than calculation. That requires you should focus during class.(Sadly only around 30/90 students attend class after midterm )
I got 97% for A+. In fact nearly 90% you can also get A+.
reviews.comment_workload: The only workload is assignment, including 10 homework. Each homework only contains about 12 questions. So workload for this class is very little. I only spend 30 mins in average for each homework.

reviews.author: JYY
reviews.title: Decent
reviews.comment_content:
The course goes through the basics of linear algebra.

The course uses this textbook: David C. Lay et al., Linear Algebra and its Applications, Fifth Edition, Pearson. It's a pretty good textbook.

Goes through these chapters:
Chap 1  Systems of Linear Equations  (~10 hours)
(i) Systems of Linear Equations; (ii) Row Reduction and Echelon Forms; (iii) Vector Equations;
(iv) The Matrix Equation ; (v) Solution Sets of Linear Systems; (vi) Linear Independence;
(vii) Linear Transformations; (viii) The Matrix of a Linear Transformation.

Chaps 2 and 3  Matrix Algebra and Determinants  (~8 hours)
(i) Matrix Operations; (ii) Matrix Inverse; (iii) Characterizations of Invertible Matrices;
(iv) Introduction to Determinants; (v) Properties of Determinants;
(vi) Cramer's Rule, Volume, and Linear Transformations

Chap 4  Vector Spaces  (~6 hours)
(i) Vector Spaces and Subspaces; (ii) Null Spaces, Column Spaces, and Linear Transformations;
(iii) Linearly Independent Sets and Bases; (iv) Coordinate Systems;
(v) The dimension of a Vector Space and Rank of a Matrix.

Chap 5             Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors  (~4 hours)
(i) Eigenvectors and Eigenvalues; (ii) The Characteristic Equation; (iii) Diagonalization;
(iv) Applications to Dynamical Systems and Differential Equations.

Chap 6 Inner Product Spaces  (~6 hours)
(i) Inner Product, Length, and Orthogonality; (ii) Orthogonal Sets; (iii) Orthogonal Projections;
(iv) The Gram-Schmidt Process; (v) Least-Squares Problems; (vi) Applications to Linear Models.

Chap 7  Symmetric Matrices and Quadratic Forms  (~2 hours)
(i) Diagonalization of Symmetric Matrices; (ii) Quadratic Forms and the Principal Axes Theorem.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lecture notes follow the textbook, can clearly see prof puts effort as they are handwritten. However, the practice problems are a lot different than exam problems as exam was heavily conceptual and the homework and lecture notes don't prepare us that well.
reviews.comment_grading:
Both midterm and finals were 20 MC problems, most were conceptual problems which is why grades were low. About 1 hour to complete 20 MC.

Midterm distribution:
Highest: 95%
Lowest: 10%
Average: 55%
Standard deviation: 18.43%

Final exam part 1:
Average: 59
Lowest score: 20
highest score: 95
standard deviation: 3.71 (I think she meant 3.71/20? not sure)

Final exam part 2:
Average: 71
lowest score: 15
highest score: 100
standard deviation: 3.51
reviews.comment_workload: Homework isn't a lot, but to do well you have to study quite a bit. Course recommends 7 hours a week (including lecture and homework).

reviews.author: dedal
reviews.title: Not recommended for freshmen :)
reviews.comment_content:
Outline
1. Linear equations in linear algebra
2-3. Matrix and determinants
4. Vector Space
5. Eigenvalues, eigenvectors and orthogonality
6. Orthogonal projection and least-square problem

Online for this semester. Pretty easy once you get the grasp of it, easy calculations. By far I think the course is more about understanding the concept than solving problems.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor tries hard to make sure everyone understands when going over a difficult/important concept. Textbook is not required.

During the tutorial, the TA solves some problems
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 30%
Final 50%
HW 20%

Open book. Midterm covered Chapters 1 to 3 and had 20 MCQs. Questions were more about the theory than calculations. The questions state the theories in a different way which made it very confusing, all my notes were of no use.  I guessed half of the answers for both midterm and final and got B+, which was higher than I thought
reviews.comment_workload:
There are weekly homework assignments, which are due about two weeks after their material is covered. The questions ask you for basic calculations and theorems. They give you unlimited attempts for most questions but there are some exceptions. The questions get harder as the course progresses.
It took me around 30 minutes to solve each set.

reviews.author: SVM
reviews.title: Horrible instructor, decent course
reviews.comment_content: The topics covered in the course are quite interesting. Vectors, determinants and matrices make up the content of most of the chapters. As such, the topics and concepts are not very hard.
reviews.comment_teaching: One word: horrible. I strongly encourage to look for another instructor, I have heard good reviews about Liux Haixia and Lee Wing Lung, so I would recommend trying to get into their lecture sections. Wong Ka Yue (Daniel) is very monotonic and robotic, and not fun to listen or talk to at all. That, along with his strange way of talking and explaining make him one of the worst instructors I have encountered in UST. Avoid.
reviews.comment_grading: 60% Final, 30% Midterm and 10% for webwork.
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork requires consistent studying, which would also be helpful for midterms and finals.

reviews.comment_grading:
mid term 30%
what you need to know about the mid term exam is only RREF and the method of finding determinant. The period for the mid term exam is very short. You may know how to do the question but you may not have enough time to do it.

final exam 60%
the final exam is very easy but the mean is just about 5x marks.
the key concept is: subspace,basis,normal equation,orthonormal basis,eigenvalue,eigenvector and diagonalization. If you know these concepts, you can score at least 70 marks.

reviews.comment_teaching: Ye's teaching is really good. Her accent is easy to follow. She could explain the concepts clearly.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Online Webwork Exercises
30% Mid-term Test
60% Final Examination
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is quite light. You can get a good grade if you study hard. I studied AL Pure Maths before. The first few chapters were overlapped in AL Pure. So it was quite easy for me. I think that if you studied M2 before. 2111 is a good course to you.
There were not a lot of proofs in the mid-terms. If you want to learn more thorough about it, i suggest you read Linear algebra and its applications by David C.Lay or Introduction to Linear Algebra by Gilbert Strang.

reviews.author: Calem
reviews.comment_content:
如果你有讀過M2，midterm之前的內容對你講好易，你可以通過簡單地做下以前的pastpaper就基本滿分。
呢個sem有啲特特別L1~L3係Dr. Ye, Guibo教，L4係Dr. Yan, Min，不論功課，midterm，final嘅內容和比重都唔同。
P.S. 如果你係Dr. Ye教建議考試唔早走，佢經出錯卷！
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Ye嘅教學雖然好中學老師咁，但她好悶，所以我只上咗幾堂課，就再冇上過。 連recording都冇睇。Tutorial 都好過她教。

Final 60% (31 MC + 3 LQ)

Grade by L4 session
Webwork + Handwriting 20%
Midterm 30% (大約20 MC + 1 LQ)
Final 50% (大約20 MC + 4 LQ)
reviews.comment_workload: 不重。 每週webwork。 有啲是概念題的，不是無限做，所以要小心。 如果你有chegg所有題目都唔係難道。不過比較煩midterm, final都有若干嘅概念題喺MC到。

reviews.author: Alex Du
reviews.comment_content:
阉割版的线性代数，因为没有奇异值相关的内容。具体的syllabus可以看其他的review。
需要注意的是虽然总体的内容少，但是涉及到的每一个章节还是比较全面的。既然是工院不是理院的课，我觉得这也在意料之中。
reviews.comment_teaching: 课程不错，特别是notes让人学到很多。所有的东西都会带证明。唯一的问题是课时太早让人想睡觉。
reviews.comment_grading:
很多人说Prof Ye是龟神，其实我觉得也就还好，没有那么神。

这学期的分布是期中30%期末60%作业10%。我的得分是期中拿到70%，期末拿到75.3%，作业全满。这个数字期中比mean高一个sd，期末比mean高1.3个sd，然后作业还是全满分（平均分90%）.

本来在我的预估内，这样的分数拿到一个A是正常的，但是我只有一个A-。也许是强者比较多的缘故，但是无论如何，既然总评平均分只有64%而我的总评平均分是78%，我还是觉得这个给分稍微偏低。
reviews.comment_workload: 10个webwork，然后就没了。每个webwork都不难，而且基本上都有一周？还是两周？的时间。反正我就没在意过，我每次webwork一出就可以1小时内做完。

reviews.author: Abeni
reviews.comment_content: Have not taken this class yet but looking for more info about it for the summer. Not really sure what else to write here but have a similar class at my home university which is known to be fairly easy so hoping this class will be similar. However, I saw that the final is worth 75% which is the highest I've seen in a class and I'm scared that if I mess up the exam my GPA will take a hit. The online homework is worth 25%, which is not bad.

reviews.comment_workload: Only webworks, tutorials and self-study, seems legit.

reviews.author: some_sbm_guy
reviews.comment_content:
Doesn't teach half the content that is supposed to be in an introductory linear algebra class. Only teaches the most basic matrix computation and concepts. I don't understand why the course teaches so slowly and repeats the same content over and over again.

Honestly I would suggest watching Strang's videos on YouTube from MIT OCW instead. It teaches much better and covers more depth and contents that are necessary/helpful for your future studies. (Complex Matrices, Fast Fourier Transforms, Pseudoinverses etc.)

Also, if you can't stand the pace either, just binge Strang's videos 3/4 days before your exams and you'll be fine.
reviews.comment_teaching: To be fair, I only went to the first two lectures, so I'm not sure if the prof is actually bad at teaching or he was forced to push extremely slowly by the course syllabus.
reviews.comment_grading:
I actually have no idea what the curve looks like. But since the exams are extremely easy (there are 10 full marks in final), you'll definitely not get an A+ if you make one mistake during exams.

I skipped two homeworks, got full in both exams. A+.
reviews.comment_workload: None. Weekly WebWork, two presentations(very easy). You don't need to work until right before exams to get prepared.

reviews.author: ruozhilaji
reviews.title: Please take MATH2131
reviews.comment_content:
Linear Algebra
The content provided by this course is too easy. I think most students have already learned all the topics in high school. Please take MATH2131 if you want to learn math.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof.YAN is patient and glad to explain everything. But he might just read his notes sometimes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Perfect!
Prof.YAN is really good. He gave 25% of students in his session A range. 25%!!!!!!!!!! It is not an H course!!! If you got mean+0.8sd, you could get A+!!!
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite light.
Although Prof.YAN gave us double homework (webwork and hard-copy homework), the questions are quite easy.
